NCEA results error leaves Tauranga student worried about university chances https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ncea-results-error-leaves-tauranga-student-worried-about-university-chances/QPPUAJSPTNE6XM4K5BIBOMJ7QY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ncea-results-error-leaves-tauranga-student-worried-about-university-chances/QPPUAJSPTNE6XM4K5BIBOMJ7QY/ Rachel MaherHe has already been told he might have to add extra time to his degree due to the error. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Ngatea man Roger "living man" Blake, pictured in 2011, has been sent to jail after being found guilty of 29 charges under the Medicines Act. Photo / Elaine Fisher

The property manager also found a cockroach infestation like the one pictured and had to call pest control on behalf of the landlord. Photo / Greg Bowker

More caulerpa seaweed discovered off Great Barrier Island, locals worried https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/locals-worried-as-more-super-spreading-seaweed-discovered-at-aotea-great-barrier-island/CPTGYECYMNGR3JIW4PSDGSJKJ4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/locals-worried-as-more-super-spreading-seaweed-discovered-at-aotea-great-barrier-island/CPTGYECYMNGR3JIW4PSDGSJKJ4/ Jamie MortonDiscovery comes amid concern some boaties are flouting rules to control exotic caulerpa. Wed, 17 Jan 2024 03:13:29 +0000 Capable of rapidly growing on the seafloor and smothering life, the bright-green exotic caulerpa seaweed's spread to several sites in Hauraki Gulf and the Bay of Islands has prompted fears of an environmental disaster for New Zealand.
